title: Energy of simple harmonic oscillators - pendulum

content.question: A simple pendulum is undergoing simple harmonic motion. Which of the following correctly indicates how the kinetic energy, <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>K</mi></math>, of the pendulum and the gravitational potential energy, <math alttext="U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>U</mi></math>, of the pendulum-Earth system are changing as the pendulum moves away from the equilibrium position?

choices.label: Both <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>K</mi></math> and <math alttext="U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>U</mi></math> are decreasing.
<math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>K</mi></math> is decreasing and <math alttext="U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>U</mi></math> is increasing.
<math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>K</mi></math> is increasing and <math alttext="U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>U</mi></math> is decreasing.
Both <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>K</mi></math> and <math alttext="U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>U</mi></math> are increasing.

content.answer: <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>K</mi></math> is decreasing and <math alttext="U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>U</mi></math> is increasing.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
